IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AESP PROVIDES TRAINING AND INFORMATION ON ENERGY EFFICIENCY, ENERGY MANAGEMENT, AND RENEWABLE RESOURCES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL CONFERENCES, WEBINARS, AND PUBLICATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AESP PROVIDES TRAINING AND INFORMATION ON ENERGY EFFICIENCY, ENERGY MANAGEMENT, AND RENEWABLE RESOURCES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL CONFERENCES, WEBINARS, AND PUBLICATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: IN 2022, AESP WAS HEAVILY IMPACTED BY THE CONTINUED EFFECTS OF COVID-19, ESPECIALLY IN THE FIRST HALF OF THE YEAR. ELEVATED PRICING FOR CONSUMER GOODS AND SERVICES FURTHER EXACERBATED THE FINANCIAL STRAIN CREATED BY COVID-19. STAFF ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A RETURN TO IN-PERSON EVENTS, BUT EXPERIENCED LOWER THAN-ANTICIPATED ATTENDANCE AND PARTICIPATION AT AESPS ANNUAL CONFERENCE AND SPRING TRAINING EVENTS, RESULTING IN HEAVY FINANCIAL LOSSES TO THE ORGANIZATION. 2022 FOCUSED ON NEW MEMBER RECRUITMENT, BETTER INTEGRATION OF CHAPTERS, IMPLEMENTATION OF NEW DEI EFFORTS, AND IMPROVEMENTS TO OUR CONTENT MANAGEMENT PROCESSES. KEY PROGRAM RELATED IMPACTS INCLUDE 10,037 INDIVIDUAL ENGAGEMENTS, 3.5 ENGAGEMENT PER MEMBER, 3,967 TOTAL MEMBERS, 24,432 MEMBER VOLUNTEER HOURS, AND 39 TRAINING COURSES OFFERED AND ATTENDED BY 475 MEMBERS.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: Financial derivatives and other financial products

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ANNUAL BONUS PAID IN MARCH WAS DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD. OTHER REPORTABLE COMPENSATION CONSISTS OF A FLEXIBLE SPENDING ACCOUNT BENEFIT THAT IS INCLUDED IN THE OFFICERS COMPENSATION PACKAGE.
ENCOLOR CONSULTING IS OWNED BY QUINN PARKER, DIRECTOR. THE BOARD MEMBERS HAVE APPROVED THE TRAINING FEE AND IT IS COMPARABLE TO OTHER LIKE SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERSHIP IN AESP IS OPEN TO ANY PERSON INDIVIDUALLY, AND ANY PERSON AS PART OF A GROUP MEMBERSHIP OR THROUGH ASSOCIATIONAL SPONSORSHIP. INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS AND MEMBERS ASSOCIATED WITH GROUP MEMBERSHIP OR SPONSORSHIP ALL HAVE THE SAME RIGHTS, PRIVILEGES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES. CORPORATIONS, PARTNERSHIPS, PROPRIETORSHIPS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OTHER BUSINESS ENTITIES ARE NOT ENTITLED TO MEMBERSHIP IN AESP THEMSELVES BUT MAY SUPPORT INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS THROUGH AESP GROUP MEMBERSHIP OR SPONSORSHIP AT THE DISCRETION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH MEMBER IN GOOD STANDING IS ELIGIBLE TO VOTE ON THE ORGANIZATIONS BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE VOTE IS DONE ELECTRONICALLY IN THE THIRD QUARTER. ELECTIONS ARE DONE ON A ONE MEMBER, ONE VOTE BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION DISTRIBUTES A PDF COPY OF THE 990 RETURN TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING FOR THIER REVENUE AND COMMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION FOR ALL OFFICERS BY COMPARING THEIR COMPENSATION TO THE COMPENSATION OF INDIVIDUALS IN LIKE POSITIONS , IN COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS USING FORMS 990, COMPENSATION STUDIES, AND OTHER AVAILABLE DATA. THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE THEN APPROVES ANY CHANGES TO THE COMPENSATION AGREEMENT BASED ON THIS INFORMATION. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES MEETING THE IRS DEFINITION OF A KEY EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION WILL PROVIDE, IN A TIMELY MANNER, COPIES OF ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHEN REQUESTED IN WRITING OR IN PERSON.
